Encode non-display text streams to UTF16

In order for CPDF to correctly support the full Unicode character set in metadata fields we need to encode to UTF16 with BOM. Previously the encoding would be based on the last-used font. Non-text streams in the PDF are not rendered using embedded fonts and so should be encoded without taking embedded font encoding into account.

This change also removes the font check from utf8toUtf16BE since this is a helper function and shouldn't need to check font support. That check is already performed by the caller.

When an element is positioned absolutely without specifying
the top/right/bottom/left properties (or when those
properties are set to "auto") it should now be placed on the
page according to where it would fall in the normal document

Improve determination of element relevance to CSS counters (#705)

The previous commit was deficient in determining when an element
incremented the counter being parsed by the counters() function.
In the previous commit elements with a value less than 1 were
excluded from the output string. However, since elements can be set
to decrement counters we need to allow values less than 1. The code
now checks to see if the current element resets the counter being
processed.

Improve parsing of counter/counters CSS content functions (#705)

Instead of exploding the string based on the argument delimeter (,)
parse the string using a regex that pulls the arguments into a
"matches" array ($args). This allows for the presence of a comma
in the joining string argument of the counters() function.

The output from the counters() function was also updated. First
the joining string is now only used between the counter instances
where previously it was also appended to the end of the output.
Second, elements that reset the counter but do not actually
increment it are skipped. This matches the output generated by
standards-compliant browsers.
